en: The Inspector General of Police, Ibrahim Idris, has said that states should first provide rranches before banning of cattle grazing.
ibo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii bụ Ibrahim Idris ekwuola ka steeti bụrụ ụzo wapụta ala ebemaka ọzụzụ ehi tupu ha amachie ịchigharị ehi
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, ọ bụ na ọ bụ ndị ọchịchị kwesịrị inye ụmụ ọhịa n'ụlọ ọrụ tupu ịmachi ọrụ ndị ahụ.

en: The Inspector General of Police said this in yesterday's security meeting at Kaduna, adding that it will help to avert problems among farmers and herders.
ibo: Onyeisi ndị uweojii kwuru nke a ụnyaahụ na kaduna na nzukọ ndị nchekwa obodo metụtara sịrị na ọ ga-enye aka igbara nsogbu na adapụta n'etiti ndị ọrụ ugbo na ndị na-achị ehi.
mt0: Ọ bụ naanị ị ga-atụgharị n'ụzọ ahụ n'ụbọchị ahụ n'ụlọ ọrụ nchekwa n'ime Kaduna, onye isi ọrụ ndị uweojii kwuru nke a n'oge nzukọ nchekwa n'ime Kaduna, sị na ọ ga-enyere aka ịkwụsị nsogbu n'etiti ndị ọrụ ugbo na ndị ọrụ ugbo.

en: He further said that the problem in Benue was because the government did not establish cattle ranch before they banned cattle grazing.
ibo: Ọ gara n'ihu kwuo na nsogbu dapụtara na Benue bụ maka na gọọmenti steeti ahụ ehibeghị ọdọ ehi tupu ha machie ịchịgharị ehi
mt0: Ọ kwuru na nsogbu n'ebe Benue bụ na ndị ọchịchị ahụ enweghị ike ịmalite ụlọ ọrụ ugbo n'ụbọchị ndị ahụ n'ụbọchị ndị ahụ.

en: In that meeting whose topic was 'Development: Security challenges and the importance of proffering adequate solution.' The farmers-herders problem did not start at the era of President Muhammadu Buhari.
ibo: Na nzukọ ahụ nke isi okwu ya bụ, 'Nkwalite obodo: Nsogbu nchekwa na mkpa ọ dị ịchọta ụzọ zuru oke ịkwụsị ya,'nsogbu dị n'etiti ndị ọrụ ugbo na ndị na-achị ehi ebidoghị n'oge ọchịchị onyeisiala bụ Muhammdu Buhari.
mt0: N'ime nzukọ ahụ nke isiokwu ya bụ 'Ndị ọrụ: Ndị ọrụ nchekwa na ịdị mkpa nke inye ụzọ dị mma', a sị na ọ dịghị mgbe ahụ ndị ọrụ ugbo-ọhịa ndị ahụ nwere nsogbu n'oge ndị ọchịchị Muhammadu Buhari.

en: Idris said: 'In my opinion, to curb farmers-herders clash, state governments should strive and build cattle ranches before they make policy to ban open grazing.
ibo: Idris kwuru sị:'N'uche m, iji belata ọgbaaghara dị n'etiti ndị ọrụ ugbo na ndị na-achị ehi, gọọmenti steeti ga-agba mbọ wuo ebe ọzụzụ ehi na steeti ha tupu ha eme iwu ikwụsị ịchịgharị ehi.
mt0: Idris kwuru: 'N'okwu m, iji zere ndị ndị na-adịghị adị n'etiti ndị ndị n'ọhịa, ndị obodo kwesịrị ịrụ ọrụ ma rụọ ụlọ ọrụ ndị ọzọ n'ụlọ ọrụ ndị ọzọ tupu ha emepụta iwu ịmachi ọrụ ndị n'ọhịa n'ụlọ ọrụ ndị ọzọ.

en: After the events of 2018 Oscars, which is the most prominent award in the movie world, BBC Igbo investigated and found out that other African countries are better than Nigeria in the area of movie production.

en: Group masquerades attacked Catholic congregation at Uke, Anambra state, injured some and destroyed thirty vehicles.
ibo: Ndị na-eti mmọnwụ wakporo ọgbakọ ndị ụka Katolik n'Uke Anambara steeti merụọ ọtụtụ ahụ ma mebie ụgbọala iri atọ.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ, ọ bụ ndị ahụ bụ ndị a na-achọghị ịkọwapụta ya. Ndị ahụ bụ ndị a na-achọghị ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ, ndị ahụ bụ ndị ahụ na-achọghị ịkọwapụta ya.

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịtụgharị ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịmataghị.

en: Masquerading is one the culture the Igbos are known for.
ibo: Ịgba mmọnwụ bụ emume omenala e jiri mara Ndigbo
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwaghị okwu ahụ, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwaghị ya. Masquerading bụ otu n'ime omenala ndị Igbos nwere ike ịkọwa.

en: Group of masquerades who were celebrating the feast of 'Uzo Iyi' at Uke in Idemili North Local Government Area, Anambra state, attacked a Catholic prayer group and destroyed more than thirty vehicles, injured many people. One of the stabbed persons died on Saturday.
ibo: Ndị mmọnwụ na-eme emume, 'Ụzọ Iyi' n'Uke dị n'ọkpuru ọchịchị Idemili Nọt n'Anambara steeti wakporo ọgbakọ ekpere ndị ụka Katolik ma mebie ihe karịrị ụgbọala iri atọ, merụọ ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ahụ, ebe e chere n'otu onye ha mara mma nwuru n'ụbọchị Satọde.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ya, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ya. Ọ bụ otu n'ime ndị a egbuola n'ụbọchị Satọde.

en: The priest in charge of the Catholic prayer group Father Emmanuel Obimma, popularly known as Ebube Muonso, and other priests and ordained women escaped from the youths that attacked those who came to worship God with a vigil from Friday night through to Saturday morning.
ibo: Onyeisi nchụaja ọgbakọ ụlọụka ahụ bụ Fada Emmanuel Obimma, nke a ma ama dị ka 'Ebube Mmụọnsọ' na ndị ụkọchụkwụ ndị ọzọ, na ndị ụmụnwaanyị e chiri echichi bịara ebe ahụ gbalahụrụ ndị ntorobịa ahụ wakporo ndị gara ikpere Chineke n'ụka ncheabalị ha mere n'abali Fraide banye n'isi ụtụtụ Satode.
mt0: Ọ bụ naanị ị ga-akpọ onye n'ụlọ ụka Katolik ahụ bụ Father Emmanuel Obimma, a na-akpọ Ebube Muonso, na ndị ụka ndị ọzọ na ndị ordained nwanyị ndị ọzọ ndị ahụ nọrọ n'ụlọ ụka ahụ n'ụbọchị Friday na Saturday.

en: The assistant priest Francis Okoye told BBC on phone that the masqueraders attacked the vigil mass by 8pm at night and injured some members of the congregation and destroyed more than thirty vehicles.
ibo: Onye nnyemaka ụkọchụkwụ bụ Francis Okoye gwara onye ntaakụkọ BBC n'ekwentị na ndị mmọnwụ wakporo ebe ọgbakọ ụka abalị ahụ n'ihe dịka elekere asatọ nke abalị merụọ ọtụtụ mmadụ ahụ ma mebie ihe karịrị ụgbọala iri atọ.
mt0: Ọkpara ndị ahụ bụ Francis Okoye gwara BBC na ekwentị na ndị ahụ ahụ ahụ ahụ n'ụtụtụ ahụ n'elekere asatọ nke ụtụtụ na-egbu ụfọdụ ndị òtù ndị ahụ ma gbuo ihe karịrị ụgbọala iri atọ.

en: Àgùlerì and Igboukwu are not the ancestral home of the Igbos.

en: It is clear that the youths of Uke who did the thing were prepared to persecute the congregation members because when Uzo Iyi is being celebrated, masquerading stops at 6pm but those masquerades attacked the adoration ground by passed 8pm.

en: News said that this was not the first time the youths of the village were persecuting the participants of the adoration organised by Catholics which takes place every Friday night, which attracts more than two thousand people every week.

en: Prominent Igbos have said that Igbos will not support Buhari in 2019 like they did in 2015.
ibo: Ndị nwere agba n'ala Igbo ekwuola na ụmụafọ ịgbo ga-ajụ nkwado onyeisiala Buhari na ntulika nke 2019 dịka ha mere n'afọ 2015.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị Igbos ndị ahụ, ọ bụghị ndị Igbos ga-adịghị ahụ ndị Igbos ga-ahụ ndị Igbos n'afọ 2019 dị ka ha mere n'afọ 2015.

en: They made the Igbos to understand that it is an empty promise that Igbos will get presidency in 2023 if they support president Buhari to win again in 2019.
ibo: Ha dọrọ Ndigbo aka na ntị ka ha mata na ngwa na ọ bụrụ na ha kwado onyeisiala Buhari ka ọ banye n'ọchịcihị ọzọ n'afọ 2019 na ọkwa onyeisiala ga-erute Igbo aka bụ nkwa a na-ekwe nwaanyị n'elu akwa, nihi na ọ bụ okwu aghụghọ.
mt0: Ọ bụghị ndị Igbos ndị ahụ nwere ike ịghọta na ọ bụ nkwa efu na Igbos ga-enweta ọchịchị n'afọ 2023 ma ha na-akwado onyeisiala Buhari ịghọ onyeisiala n'afọ 2019.

en: Not long ago, some members of APC which include the Minister of Transport , Rotimi Amechi, Secretary to the state government, Boss Mustapha and the Chairman of Voice of Nigeria, Osita Okechukwu, told the Igbos to vote for Buhari in 2019 in order to get their own share in www.
ibo: Na nsọnsọ, otụtụ ndị otu APC gụnyere, Minista na ahụmaka njem bụ Rotimi Amaechi, onye odeakwụkwọ nke gọọmenti etiti bụ Boss Mustafa na kwa onyeisi ndị ụlọọrụ Voice of Nigeria nbụ Ọsita Okechukwu gwara Ndị Igbo ka ha tụnyere Buhari na'afọ 2019, ka oke were rute ha na 2023.
mt0: Ọ dịghị anya, ndị APC ndị gụnyere Minister of Transport , Rotimi Amechi, Secretary to the state government, Boss Mustapha na Chairman of Voice of Nigeria, Osita Okechukwu, gwara ndị Igbos ịbịa ịhọrọ Buhari n'afọ 2019 iji nweta ohere ịzụta onwe ha n'ime Voice of Nigeria.

en: On the same hand, the former president of Ohanaeze Ndigbo, Dozie Ikedife, said that the Igbos who were promised presidency did not participate the last time.

mt0: On the other hand, the former president of Ohanaeze Ndigbo, Dozie Ikedife, said that the Igbos who were promised presidency did not participate last time.

en: He told Sun Newspaper 'The Igbos were promised the same way in the past, we were equally deceived.

en: Soyinka, who said this on Sunday in the posthumous birthday ceremony of a well acclaimed lawyer Gani Fawehinmi which took place in Lagos said that democracy is in danger in Nigeria.
ibo: Soyinka, onye nke kwuru nke a ụbọchịụka n'emụme ncheta ọmụmụ onye ọkaiwu a mara amara nwụrụ anwụ bụ Gani Fawehinmi nke e mere na Legọs kwuru na obodo Naijiria na ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya nọ na nsogbu ugbua.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụbọchị Sunday n'oge ahụ a na-eme ncheta ndị a n'ụlọ ọrụ ikpe dị n'aka Gani Fawehinmi n'obodo Lagos, Soyinka kwuru na democracy dị n'ihe ize ndụ na Nigeria.

en: He said that those who put Nigeria in her present situation through their policies have again presented themselves as messiah because election is forthcoming, and advised Nigerians to reject old politicians in order to give new age politicians the opportunity to take over power.
ibo: Ọ si na ndị tinyere Naịjirịa na nsogbu ọ nọ na ya ugbua site na atụmatụ ha, e jikerela onwe ha ọzọ dịka ndị nzọpụta ka ntuliaka na-abịa, ma dụọ ndị Naijiria ọdụ ka ha jụ ndị ndọrọndọrọ ochie iji nye ohere ka ndị agba ọhụrụ were ọchịchị.
mt0: Ọ sị na ndị ahụ nwere ike ịme ka Nigeria dị n'ọnọdụ ahụ n'ihi ndị ọchịchị ha nwere ike ịpụta onwe ha dị ka onye nsọ n'ihi na ọchịchị dị nso, ma ọ gwara ndị Nigeria ka ha jụọ ndị ọchịchị ochie iji nye ndị ọchịchị ndị ọhụrụ ohere ịbịakwute ọchịchị.

en: Buhari and APC leaders have had discussion.
ibo: Buhari na ndị isi otu APC enwela mkparịta ụka
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịtụgharị n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwereghị ike ịtụgharị n'ụzọ dị iche iche. Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịtụgharị n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwereghị ike ịtụgharị n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: He said: 'It is not in doubt that democracy is in danger.'
ibo: Ọ sịrị: 'A naghị enyo ya enyo na ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya nọ na nsogbu.
mt0: Ọ sị: 'Ọ dịghị n'aka na ọchịchị dị n'oge ahụ.' Ọ sị: 'Ọ dịghị n'aka na ọchịchị dị n'oge ahụ.' Ọ sị: 'Ọ dịghị n'aka na ọchịchị dị n'oge ahụ.' Ọ sị: 'Ọ dịghị n'aka na ọchịchị dị n'oge ahụ.' Ọ sị: 'Ọ dịghị n'aka na ọchịchị dị n'oge ahụ.'

en: It is not only democracy, our country is in trouble.
ibo: Ọ bụghị sọsọ ọchịchị onyekwuoucheya, obodo anyi nọ na nsogbu.
mt0: Ọ bụghị naanị democracy, obodo anyị nọ n'ọnọdụ nsogbu.

en: I don't think that there was a time in the entire world, most especially in this nation, a time where protection of everything is soured like this.
ibo: Echeghị m na o nwere oge na ndụ niile n'ụwa , ọkachasị n'ala a oge nchere ihe niile dakpọrọ adakọ otu a.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ, ọ bụghị naanị n'ụwa, ma ọ bụ n'obodo a, oge ahụ bụ oge ndị ahụ nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ dị ka nke a.

en: We all know this.
ibo: Anyị niile maa nke a.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịtụgharị n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwereghị ike ịtụgharị n'ụzọ dị iche iche. Anyị niile maara nke a.

en: The question is whether we are seeing it as a redeeming opportunity or are we seeing it as an opportunity to keep doing those things that made our nation a failure?
ibo: Ajụjụ bụ anyị ana-ahụ ya dịka ohere nzọpụta ka anyị a na ahụ ya ha ohere ị ga n'ihu na-eme ihe ndị ahụ mere na ala anyị na akpụ afọ n'ala?
mt0: Ọ bụ ajụjụ bụ ma anyị na-ahụ ya dị ka ohere ịzọpụta ma ọ bụ na anyị na-ahụ ya dị ka ohere ịzọpụta obodo anyị n'ụzọ ndị ahụ mere ka ọ dị njọ?

en: It is no longer a news how important it is to do the things that will save the unity of our nation Nigeria.
ibo: Ọ bụghị akụkọ ọhụrụ mkpa ọ dị imee ihe ga-azọ ịdịkọnotu ala Naijiria.

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ, ị ga-amalite n'ụtụtụ nke iri na asatọ mana ị malite n'ụtụtụ nke iri na asatọ.

en: When I got to that place, they took m to the office of the Nigeria Ambassador.
ibo: Mgbe m ruru ebe ahụ, ha kpọrọ m ga n'ụlọọrọ onye na-anọchịte anya Naịjirịa.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na m ruru ebe ahụ, ha kpọtara m n'ụlọ ọrụ nke onye ndị nnọchiteanya Nigeria.

en: Those who came for the meeting were there, the Vice president was absent, the Ministers were absent, said Sanusi.
ibo: Ndị bịara nzụkọ ahụ nọ ebe ahụ, osote onyeisiala anọghị, ndị mịnịsta anọghị, Sanusi kwuru.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ, onye ndị ndị ndị ahụ nọ n'ebe ahụ, onye ndị ndị ndị ahụ nọ n'ebe ahụ, onye ndị ndị ahụ nọ n'ebe ahụ, kwuru Sanusi.

en: Sanusi said that what they did was not good, because it showed that Nigeria was not yet prepared for what was being talked about.
ibo: Sanusi sị na ihe a mere adịghị mma, maka na ọ na-egosi na Naịjirịa adịbeghi nkwadobe maka ihe a na-ekwu okwu ya.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ihe ahụ mere adịghị mma, n'ihi na ọ pụtara na Nigeria adịghị emepụta maka ihe a na-ekwu okwu banyere.

en: He said 'You called people to come and hear how trading is done in Nigeria but you did not come. '
ibo: O kwuru, 'Unu kpọrọ ndị mmadụ ka ha bịa nụrụ etu e si atụ mgbere na Naịjirịa, mana unu abịaghị.
mt0: Ọ sị, 'Ị kpọtụrụ ndị mmadụ ka ha bịa nụ ụzọ ịzụta ndị ọrụ n'obodo Nigeria mana ị nọghị.'

en: This is not how to get people that will invest in Nigeria.
ibo: Ọbụghi etu a ka esi enwete ndị ga-etinye ego na Naịjirịa.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị mmadụ ndị ga-achọ ịbanye n'ime Nigeria, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị mmadụ ndị ga-abanye n'ime Nigeria.

en: If it were to be Ruwandans that organised this meeting, their president, Paul Kagame would be there telling the people to start coming to Ruwanda.
ibo: Ya bụrụ na ọ bụ ndị Rụwanda haziri ọgbakọ a, onyeisiala ha bu Kagame ga-anọ ebe ahụ na-agwa ndi mmadụ bịawa Rụwanda.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ọ bụ ndị Ruwandans ndị nwere ike ịhazi nzukọ a, onyeisiala ha, Paul Kagame nwere ike ịnọ ebe a ịgwa ndị mmadụ ka ha malite ịga Ruwanda.

en: People lent their voices on social media
ibo: Ndị mmadụ tinyekwere ọnụ n'okwu a na soshal midia.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị mmadụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ha n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: The owner of the handle @SegunAndrews agreed to what Sanusi said.
ibo: Onye nwere akara @SegunAndrews kwenyere n'ihe Sanusi kwuru.
mt0: @SegunAndrews onye nwe n'aka @SegunAndrews kwenyere ihe Sanusi kwuru.

en: But, the government have denied that it was not how the thing happened.
ibo: Mana, gọọmentị ekwuola na ọbụghị etu a ka ha bụ ihe siri ga.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ọ bụghị otú ihe ahụ mere.

en: Lai Mohammed, the Minister of information has sent out message explaining that it was not true that those who were supposed to go for the meeting did not go.

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe. en: Ikeogu Oke won $10,000 as the winner of the 'Nigerian Prize of Literature.'
ibo: Ikeogu Oke ritere puku dọla 100 dịka onye ọkachasị ede mbem na Naịjira n'afọ 2017.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche. Ikeogu Oke nwere $10,000 dịka onye ndị mmeri nke 'Nigerian Prize of Literature'.

en: The winner of the 'Nigerian Prize of Literature,' Ikeogu Oke has said that Igbo will not go into extinction if the Igbos value it
ibo: Onye ritere ihe nrite dịka onye bụ ọkachasị n'ide akwụkwọ na Naịjirịa n'afọ 2017 bụ Ikeogu Oke ekwuola na asụsụ Igbo agaghị anwụ ma ndị Igbo kpọọ ya mkpa.
mt0: Ikeogu Oke, onye mmeri nke 'Nigerian Prize of Literature', kwuru na Igbo agaghị ebiri n'ọnwụ ma ọ bụrụ na Igbos nwere ike ịhụ ya dị ka ihe dị iche iche.

en: Ikeogu received $10,000 as the winner of the 'Nigerian Prize of Literature' for his book 'The Heresaid.'
ibo: Ikeogu ritere ego puku dọla 100 dịka onye kachasị ede mbem na Naịjirịa nke a kpọrọ 'Nigerian Prize of Literature' maka akwụkwọ ya ọ kpọrọ “The Heresiad”.
mt0: Ikeogu nwere $10,000 dịka onye nwere 'Nigerian Prize of Literature' maka akwụkwọ ya 'The Heresaid.'

en: What made the book the best was that he wrote it in the form of Igbo oral poem.
ibo: Ihe mere akwụkwọ ahụ ọdị iche bụ na o dere ya n'usoro ndị Igbo ji agụ mbem.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwa ya n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: In his discussion with the BBC Igbo Mr Oke talked of the promotion of Igbo language and those whose duty it is to do it.
ibo: Na mkparịta ụka ya na BBC Igbo nwere, Maazị Oke kwuru okwu gbasara nchekwa asụsụ Igbo, na onye o chere na o kwesịri ịdị n'aka ya.
mt0: Ọ bụ na n'okwu ya na BBC Igbo, Mr Oke kwuru banyere ịkwalite asụsụ Igbo na ndị ọrụ ndị dị n'ọrụ ịkwalite ya.

en: The federal government has decided on what to do with Abacha's loot.
ibo: Gọọmentị etiti ekwuola ihe a ga-eji ego Abacha zuru mee
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ihe ị ga-eme na ndị ahụ ndị ahụ.

en: The Minister of Finance Kemi Adeosun has said what the government will use Abacha's loot for in Nigeria.
ibo: Kemi Adeosun bụ minista na-elekọta ihe gbasara ego ekwuola ihe gọọmentị etiti ga-eji ego Abacha mee na Naịjirịa.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ihe ndị ahụ ga-eji n'aka Abacha's loot n'ime Nigeria.

en: Kemi Adeosun and Christine Lagarde, the chairman of IMF
ibo: Kemi Adeosun na Christine Lagarde bụ onyeisi oche na IMF
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe.

en: The Nigerian government have mapped out what to do with more than three hundred million dollars Abacha's loot returned by Swiss.
ibo: Gọọmentị Naijiria akwadola iji ihe kariri dọlla nde dọlla narị atọ bụ ego Abacha zuru nke gọọmentị Swiss weghachitere ga-eme.
mt0: N'ihi na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ihe ị ga-eme na ego ndị ọzọ karịrị nde iri atọ ndị Swiss zigara Abacha n'ụlọ ọrụ ndị ahụ.

en: Minister of Finance, Kemi Adeosun, has said that the money would be given to the poor as contained in campaign promises of President Buhari.
ibo: Minista na-ahụ maka ihe gbasara ego bụ Kemi Adeosun ekwuola na a ga-eji ego ahụ zụọ ndị ụbiam dịka Onyeisiala Buhari kwere na nkwa mgbe ọ na-azọ ọchịchị.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe, sị na onye nchịkwa ego, Kemi Adeosun, kwuru na ego a ga-enye ndị nwere ike ịkwụ ụgwọ dị ka ọ dị na nkwa ndị ahụ nke onye isi ala Buhari.

en: She said this while speaking to journalists at the end of the meeting International Monetary Fund in Washington DC, America.
ibo: O kwuru nke a ebe ọ na-ezi ndị ntaakụkọ ozi na ngwucha nzụkọ ngalaba na-eke ego n'ụwa niile bụ IMF na-aha ịchafụ nke mere n'obodo Washington na Amerịka.
mt0: Ọ sị nke a mgbe o kwuru okwu ndị ndị nta akụkọ n'oge nzukọ International Monetary Fund na Washington DC, America.

en: Adeosun also said that the money has been deposited in Nigeria's special treasury in the central bank of Nigeria in order to think out best idea for the poor.
ibo: Adeosun sị kwa na-etinyela ego a n'akpa pụrụiche n'ụlọakụ Niajiria a kpọrọ CBN n'aha ịchafụ iji bido mepụta atụmatụ ndị ga-enyere ndị ogbenye aka.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ, sị na ego ahụ a na-etinye na ụlọ ọrụ ndị ọzọ nke Nigeria na ụlọ ọrụ ndị ọzọ nke Nigeria iji chọpụta ụzọ kachasị mma maka ndị ọjọọ.

ibo: Ndị omeiwu sineti dị mmadị 109, ọ bụrụ na mmadụ 108 nọ na be Ekweremmadu ugbua, ọ pụtara na ha niile nọ na be ya.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ndị senator 109 n'ụlọ nzukọ Ekweremadu ugbu a, ma ọ bụrụ na 108 n'ime ha nọ n'ụlọ nzukọ Ekweremadu ugbu a, ọ pụtara na ha niile nọ n'ụlọ nzukọ Ekweremadu ugbu a.

en: Remember that the Senate resolved today that security agents should immediately leave the deputy senate president's house, where they attacked him today.
ibo: Cheta na ụlọomeiwu sineti kpebiri taa ka ndị ọrụ nchekwa pụọ n'ụlọ osote onyeisi sineeti bụ Ike Ekweremadu ozugbo, ebe ha wakporo taa.
mt0: N'ihi na a nwere ike ịkọwa na ndị nnọchiteanya ndị ahụ nwere ike ịpụ n'ụlọ onye nnọchiteanya ndị ahụ n'ụlọ onye nnọchiteanya ndị ahụ n'ụbọchị a, ebe ha nwere ike ịgbaso ya n'ụbọchị a.

en: Ekweremadu was blocked from leaving his house this morning, which stopped him from attending today's Senate meeting, where 14 senators defected from APC to PDP.
ibo: E gbochiri Ekweremadu ịpụta n'ụlọ ya n'ụtụtụ taa, mere ka ọ ghara ịbịa nzukọ ndị ụlọomeiwu ukwu mere taa, ebe ndị omeiwu ruru 14 hapụrụ APC gafee PDP.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwaghị okwu ahụ, ọ bụ na a machibidoro Ekweremadu ịpụ n'ụlọ ya n'ụtụtụ a, nke a machibidoro ya ịga nzukọ ndị senatorị ahụ nke ụbọchị a, ebe ndị senatorị 14 ndị APC nọrọ n'ọchịchị PDP.

en: Uche Anichukwu, Ekweremadu's spokesperson, told BBC Igbo that it was EFCC that blocked him from leaving his house in Abuja, not DSS as was formerly written by us.
ibo: Uche Anichukwu bụ ọnụ na-ekwuchitere Ekweremadu, gwara BBC Igbo na ndị EFCC gbochiri ya ịpụ n'ụlọ ya n'Abuja, na ọ bụghị DSS dịka anyị dere mbụ.
mt0: Ọ bụ naanị ị ga-akpọpụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche. Uche Anichukwu, onye nkwupụta Ekweremadu, gwara BBC Igbo na ọ bụ EFCC bụ onye machibidoro ya ịpụ n'ụlọ ya n'Abuja, ọ bụghị DSS dị ka a kọwara n'oge gara aga.

en: @MrBanksOmishore, Special Assistant to Saraki, this morning wrote the message EFCC sent to Ekweremadu on Twitter.
ibo: @MrBanksOmishore bụ onye enyemaka pụrụiche nke Bukola Saraki, depụtara akwụkwọ ozi ndị EFCC ziteere Ekweremadu n'ụtụtụ a, na Twitter.
mt0: @MrBanksOmishore, Special Assistant to Saraki, kwuru ozi EFCC nyere Ekweremadu n'ụtụtụ a na Twitter.

en: In that message, EFCC said that they want to probe Ekweremadu for planning to use his position to manipulate carrying out of the country called money laundering in English.
ibo: N'ime akwụkwọ ozi ahụ, EFCC kwuru na ha chọrọ inyocha Ekweremadu maka ịkpa nkata, mmerụ ikike ọkwa ya nyere ya na ibupu ego nke Bekee kpọrọ 'money laundering'.
mt0: N'ime ozi ahụ, EFCC kwuru na ha chọrọ ịmalite nnyocha Ekweremadu maka ịtụ anya iji ọkwa ya iji nweta ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ ego n'ụwa a akpọ

en: When Saraki entered the Senate building and started plenary, he said that Ekweremadu could not come, and said that they should strive to see that democracy did not die.
ibo: Ka Saraki banyere n'ụlọomeiwu ma bido 'plenary', o kwutere okwu na Ekweremdu abịanwughị, ma kwuo na-ekwesịrị ịgba mbọ hụ na ọchịchị onyekwuouche ya emebighị.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na Saraki banye n'ụlọ nzukọ Senate ma bido nzukọ, ọ sị na Ekweremadu enweghị ike ịbịa, na ọ sị na ha kwesịrị ịhụ na democracy adịghị ebibi.

en: Senator Sam Anyanwu said that he was with Ekweremadu yesterday but he did not get a warrant of being wanted by the police.
ibo: Omeiwu Sam Anyanwu kwuru na ya na Ekweremadu nọ ụnyaahụ, mana onweteghị akwụkwọ gosiri na ndị uweojii na-achọ ya.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na onye ndị senator Sam Anyanwu kwuru na ọ nọnyere Ekweremadu n'ụbọchị ahụ mana ọ nwetaghị warrant nke ịbụ onye achọpụtara ndị uweojii.

en: After the plenary, the senators resolved that the security agents should leave the house of the Deputy Senate President to enable him utilize the authority due to him.
ibo: Ka e mechara 'plenary', ndị omeiwu kpebiri na ndị ọrụ nchekwa kwesịrị ịpụ n'ụlọ osote onyeisi sineeti bụ Ike Ekweremadu ozugbo, ka o nwee ike rite ikike ruru ya.
mt0: N'oge nzukọ ahụ, ndị senatorị ahụ nwere ike ịtụ aro na ndị uweojii ndị ahụ kwesịrị ịpụ n'ụlọ Deputy Senate President iji nye ya ohere iji ike ndị ahụ nwere ike iji.

en: This morning, Saraki is among those blocked from leaving their houses.
ibo: N'ụtụtụ a, Saraki so na ndị egbochiri ịpụ n'ezi ụlọ ya.
mt0: Ọ bụ naanị ị ga-atụgharị n'ụtụtụ a, Saraki bụ onye a na-amachi ịpụpụ ụlọ ha.

en: On the other hand, Nigeria President, Muhammadu Buhari thanked those that defected from APC today and wished them well.
ibo: N'aka ọzọ, onyeisi ala Naịjirịa bụ Muhammadu Buhari kelere ndị siri na APC pụọ taa ka ọ gara ha nke ọma.
mt0: Ọzọ, Onyeisiala Nigeria, Muhammadu Buhari ekeleere ndị ndị ndị nwụchiri APC taa ma sị ha nwee ọganihu.

en: He said this through His Twitter handle, @MBuhari.
ibo: O kwuru nke a site na akara Twita ya bụ @MBuhari:
mt0: Ọ kwuru nke a site na akaụntụ Twitter ya, @MBuhari.

en: EFCC blocked Ekweremadu's door in Abuja.
ibo: Ndị EFCC gbochiri ọnụụzọ Ekweremadu n'Abuja
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwereghị ike ịkọwapụta ha n'ụzọ dị iche iche. EFCC ebiri ụzọ Ekweremadu n'ime Abuja.

en: Television was showing EFCC's gun pointing at the front of Ekweremadu's house.
ibo: Ihe onyoonyo na-egosi ebe ndị EFCC chewere n'ihu ụlọ Ekweremadu:
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche. Television ahụ gosipụtara igwe egwu nke EFCC n'ihu ụlọ Ekweremadu.

en: Those who kidnapped and killed a Catholic priest have been sentenced to death.
ibo: A maala ndị tọọrọ ma gbuo ụkọchuckwu ụka Katolik ikpe ọnwụ
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ ndị egbuola onye ndị ụka Katọlik, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: High court has sentenced those who kidnapped and killed Father John Adeyi to death by hanging.

en: Court has given order to hang the criminals.
ibo: Ụlọikpe enyela iwu ka akwụgbu ndị omekome
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ha n'ụzọ dị iche iche. Ụlọ ikpe nyere iwu ịkwụsị ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: High court in Makurdi, Benue state, have decided to hang two people, Hartuna Idi and Suleiman Gina, who are the remnant of those who kidnapped and killed Father John Adeyi till they died for what they committed.
ibo: Ndị ụlọikpe ukwu dị na Makurdi, Benue steeti ekpebiela ka a kwụgbuo mmadụ abụọ, Hartuna Idi na Suleiman Gina bụ ndị fọrọ na ndị tọrọ ma gbuo Fada John Adeyi rue oge ha nwụrụ maka ihe ha mere.
mt0: Ndị ikpe n'obodo Makurdi, Benue state, ekpebiri ịkwụ ụgwọ abụọ, Hartuna Idi na Suleiman Gina, ndị bụ ndị ndị bụ ndị ndị nwere ike ịkwụ ụgwọ ndị ahụ ndị nwere ike ịkwụ ụgwọ ndị ahụ ndị nwere ike ịkwụ ụgwọ ndị ahụ ndị nwere ike ịkwụ ụgwọ ndị ahụ ndị nwere ike ịkwụ ụgwọ ndị ahụ ndị nwere ike ịkwụ ụgwọ ndị ahụ n'ihi ihe ha mere.

ibo: Cheta na ndị ntọọ mmadụ anọ gụnyere Saidu Abdullahi na Aliyu Garba tọrọ Fada Adeyi, onye Vika-Jenaraalụ ụka Katọlik n'Otukpo Dayosis, Benue steeti, gbuo ya ma tufuo ozu ya n'ime ugbo dị nso na Otukpo n'afọ 2016.
mt0: Nwere ike ịghọta na ndị ndị ndị ahụ gụnyere Saidu Abdullahi na Aliyu Garba nwere ike ịkwụsị onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ n'aka onye ndị ahụ

en: But the police later arrested four of them, they confessed that they collected N1.7m ransom but they shot him to death when they heard that the villagers were coming to redeem him from their captivity.
ibo: Mana e mechara ndị uweojii nwuchie ha anọ, ha kwupụta na ha natara ezinaụlọ ụkọchukwu ahụ otu nde naira na ụma(N1.7m) dịka ego isi ya mana ha gbagburu ya oge ha nụrụ na ndị obodo jikere ịbịa gbapụta ya ebe ha nwụchiri ya.
mt0: Ọ bụ ndị uweojii ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị

en: One of them confessed that he was the one that shot him to death. The remaining two were sentenced to death today being Wednesday.
ibo: Otu n'ime ha kwupụtara na ọ bụ ya gbara ya egbe gburu ya, ebe a mara mamdụ abụọ fọrọ n'ime ha ikpe ọnwụ taa bụ Wenezde.
mt0: Ọ bụ otu n'ime ha kwuru na ọ bụ ya bụ onye egbuola ya. Ndị ọzọ abụọ ahụ nwere ike ịbụ ndị ikpe ikpe n'ụbọchị taa bụ ụbọchị Tusdee.

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ime ozi ahụ ndị ezinụlọ onye nsọ zigara Daily Post, ha kwuru ekele ha na ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe ikpe

en: But they grieved that the judgement reminded them of the murder of Adeyi, who was a professor.

en: An expert in Africa and language studies in University of Lagos, Chiagozie Nnabuihe, explained to BBC Igbo that Igbo called this place forest of the spirits, and not evil forest like so many people call it now.

en: This place was also a place where they excommunicated anybody cursed by the land.

mt0: Ọ bụkwa ebe ahụ bụ ebe a na-ekpuchi ndị a na-atụ egwu n'ala.

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta n'ụwa ahụ, sị na Chineke bụ nke kachasị mkpa, mana ọ bụ n'ụwa ahụ bụ n'ezie n'ụwa ahụ.

en: Murder is a taboo

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịtụgharị n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị maghị. Ndị mmehie bụ ihe a na-adịghị ekwesị.

en: Igbo believe that the land sees everything, this means that there is no sin you can hide away from it.

en: Then power suppliers were saying that they had no power to supply in Nigeria.
ibo: Mgbe ahụ, ndị na-eke ọkụ na-ekwu na ha enweghị nke ha ga-ekenye ụmụ Naịjirịa.
mt0: Ndị na-enye ike ndị ahụ kwuru na ha enweghị ike inye ike n'obodo Nigeria.

en: Then, we were distributing 2,690 megawatts to Nigerians, but the story has changed.
ibo: Mgbe ahụ, anyị na-eke 'megawatt' 2,690 nye ndị Naịjirịa, mana akụkọ ahụ agbanwela.
mt0: N'oge ahụ, anyị na-enye ndị Nigeria 2,690 megawatts, mana akụkọ ahụ gbanwere.

en: What we have to distribute now is 5,222, which is the highest since the inception of Nigeri's existence.
ibo: Ihe anyị nwere ike ugbua bụ megawat 5,222, nke bụ nke kachasị kamgbe Naịjirịa pụtara.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ihe ị ga-enye n'oge a, ọ bụ 5,222, nke bụ nke kachasị elu kemgbe ntọala nke Nigeri.

en: Now, what is being generated and distributed is 7000 megawatts.
ibo: Ugbua, ihe a na-emepụta bụ megawatt 7000, ma na-ekekwa 7000.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ihe a na-emepụta ma na-adịkarị n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị maghị.

en: There is still problem, but we will say that we are progressing.

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe, sị na ị nwere nsogbu, mana anyị ga-ekwu na anyị na-aga n'ihu.

en: Finally, if you are someone who is very interested in culture, this long vacation is the time you can initiate them into masquerade or age grade in your village.

mt0: N'ikpeazụ, ọ bụrụ na ị bụ onye nwere nnukwu mmasị na omenala, oge a dị gị n'ụlọ ọrụ a dị gị n'anya ị ga-amalite ịkụzi ha n'ime masquerade ma ọ bụ ụmụaka n'obodo gị.

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ, sị na ọ bụ n'ihi nkọwa nke nwoke ya mere ha ji bido nnyocha ma chọpụta na ọ bụ n'ihi nwanyị ya na ndị ọzọ ndị ọzọ mere okwu ahụ.

en: A professor of psychology and lecturer in Ebonyi State University Nnachi Amos said that psychological problem was not the cause but that there are many evils presently.

mt0: Ọ bụ onye ọka mmụta psychology na onye nkuzi na mahadum Ebonyi State Nnachi Amos kwuru na nsogbu ahụ abụghị ihe kpatara ya ma na ọtụtụ ndị ọjọọ dị ugbu a.

en: Most times people ask the reason behind marrying a woman's corpse in some areas of Igbo land, this story explained it.

en: Most often there are news of youths who love themselves, and agreed to live together as husband and wife without fulfilling the cultural demands for marriage.
ibo: A na-enwetakarị akụkọ gbasara ụfọdụ ndị ntorobịa maọbụ agbọghọbịa hụrụ onwe ha n'anya, ma kwekọrịtara ibikọta ọnụ dịka di na nwunye, mana ha emeghị omenala alụmdinanwunye dịka ha kwesịrị.
mt0: Ọtụtụ mgbe ndị ọgbọ ndị ahụ na-ahụ maka onwe ha na-achọ ịdị n'otu ma nọrọ n'ọnụ ọgụgụ dị iche iche n'enweghị ịgbaso iwu omenala maka ndị ahụ ịbụ ndị nwanyị na nwanyị.

en: Sometimes unforseen circumstances arise in this situation, especially the woman dieing in the man's house when the cultural marriage rites were not performed.
ibo: A na-ahụtakwa mgbe ụfọdụ ihe mberede dị iche iche n'ọnọdụ a, ọkachasị nwaanyị ịnọ n'ụlọ nwoke ahụ nwụọ na-enweghị mmemme alụm ọbụla emere n'ụzọ omenala.
mt0: Ọ nwere ike ịbịa n'ọnọdụ a n'ụzọ ahụ n'ihi na ọtụtụ mgbe ndị mmadụ na-anwụ n'ụlọ nwoke n'ihi na ọ dịghị eme ụmụ nwanyị n'ụlọ nwoke ahụ n'ihi na ụmụ nwanyị ahụ nwụọla n'ụlọ nwoke ahụ mgbe ụmụ nwanyị ahụ nwụọla n'ụlọ nwoke ahụ mgbe ụmụ nwanyị ahụ nwụọla n'ụlọ nwoke ahụ.

en: Women's title in Igbo land
ibo: Echichi nwaanyị n'ala Igbo
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: Five things that interest women
ibo: Ihe ise masịrị ụmụnwaanyị
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ihe ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwereghị ike ịkọwapụta ihe ndị ahụ.

en: Is 'Omugwo' a tradition to abolish in Igbo land?
ibo: Ọmụgwọ ọ bụ omenala ga-akwụsị n'ala Igbo?
mt0: Ọ bụ omenala ịkwụsị 'Omugwo' na ala Igbo?

en: However, this causes confusion in different families.
ibo: Ka o sila dị, nke a na-etinyekarị ezinaụlọ dị iche iche na gbagharịa.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịtụgharị okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwereghị ike ịtụgharị okwu ahụ.

en: Because of this bad condition, many villages in Igbo land, made it a law that a man will marry the corpse of a woman whom he was living with him without paying the complete dowry
ibo: N'ihi ajọ ọnọdụ a, ụfọdụ obodo dị n'ala Igbo, mere ya ka ọ bụrụ iwu na nwoke ga-alụ nwaanyị ya na ya bi n'ozu, bụ nke ọ na-emeghị mgbe ọ dị ndụ.
mt0: N'ihi nke a njọ ọnọdụ, ọtụtụ obodo n'ala Igbo emeela iwu na nwoke ga-ahụ n'ụlọ nwanyị ahụ n'ụlọ n'enweghị ịkwụ ụgwọ zuru oke.

en: The reason for marrying a woman's corpse.
ibo: Ihe mere eji alụ nwaanyị n'ozu:
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: Igbo land, a man is not married unless he paid the woman's dowry.
ibo: N'ala Igbo, anaghị ekweta na nwoke alụọla nwaanyị, maọbụrụ na o mezubeghị ihe n'isi ya.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa ala ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe, ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa ala ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe, a nwoke adịghị ahụ nwanyị ma ọ bụrụ na ọ nwụnye ụgwọ ụgwọ ụmụaka ahụ.

en: If even he married in court, he is expected to go to the woman's family and do things as they want.
ibo: Ọ bụrụgodu na o mere nke ụlọikpe, a tụrụ anya na ọ ga-abịa mekwaa ihe dịka ndị nwe nwa siri chọọ.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ọ lụrụ n'ụlọ ikpe, ọ dị n'aka ya ịga n'ụlọ nwanyị ahụ ma mee ihe dị ka ha chọrọ.

en: Like an expert in culture, Nze Olueze Ukaejuoha (Duruagwu the second) of Umuakara, Isu in Nwangele of Imo State, told BBC Igbo, this law is very potent in their village, it goes different punishments.
ibo: Dịka ọkachamara n'okwu gbasara omenala bụ Nze Olueze Ụkaejuoha (Duruagwụ nke abụọ) n'Ụmụakara, Isu dị na Nwangele nke Imo steeti siri gwa BBC Igbo, iwu a dị ezigbo ire n'obodo ha, bụkwa nke nwere ntaramahụhụ dị iche iche so ya.
mt0: Nke Olueze Ukaejuoha (Duruagwu the second) of Umuakara, Isu in Nwangele of Imo State, told BBC Igbo, a law is very potent in their village, it goes different punishments.

en: He who does not marry alive, marries in death, is the system most villages adopted.
ibo: Onye n'alụghị na ndụ, ọ lụ ọ n'ọnwụ, bụ usoro ọtụtụ obodo si eme
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwaghị okwu ahụ, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwaghị ya, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwaghị ya.

en: But in Akokwa village also in Imo State, this thought is not potent at all, where the woman's family come and take the corpse of their daughter home for burial.
ibo: Mana n'obodo Akọkwa dịkwa n'Imo steeti, atụmatụ a adịghị ire ọbụla, ebe ezinaụlọ mụrụ nwaanyị na-abịa eburu ozu nwa ha ma gaa lie n'ụlọ ha.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'Akokwa obodo dị na steeti Imo, okwu ahụ adịghị ike ịkọwa, ebe ndị nne na nna nwaanyị ahụ na-abịa n'ụlọ n'ihi n'ụlọ nsọ.

en: The system for marrying a woman's corpse
ibo: Usoro esi alụ nwaanyị n'ozu:
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa ụzọ ịgba nwanyị n'ime n'aka nwanyị ahụ, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwa ụzọ ịgba nwanyị n'aka nwanyị ahụ.

en: The man will first come and told the family that their daughter is sick (he will not tell them that she is dead at first).
ibo: Onye ahụ ga-abịa gwa ndị mụ nwa na nwa ha nwere ahụ ọkụ (ọ gaghị ebu ụzọ agwa ha na ọ nwụọla).
mt0: Ọ ga-amalite ịbịakwute ezinụlọ ahụ na nwa nwaanyị ha dị ọrịa (ọ gaghị agwa ha na ọ dị ndụ n'oge mbụ).

en: They will follow him to visit their daughter, when they have seen her, they will accuse the man of killing their daughter, and the man will start denying it.
ibo: Ha ga-eso ya gaa 'leta' nwa ha, mgbe ha hụrụ ozu ya, ha ga-ebo nke nwoke ebubo na ọ bụ ya gburu nwa ha, nke ga-eme ka ọ gọwa ụkwụ na aka ya
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ha enweghị ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ, ha ga-eso ya ileta nwa ha, mgbe ha hụtara ya, ha ga-atụ egwu nwoke ahụ maka ịgburu nwa ha, ma nwoke ahụ ga-amalite ịjụ ya.

en: To prove that he did not kill her he would agree to marry the woman's corpse.
ibo: Iji gosi na ọ bụghị ya gburu ya ọ ga-ekwenye ịlụ ozu nwaanyị ahụ
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche. Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: He will come and marry it.
ibo: Ọ ga-abịa lụọ ya
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịtụgharị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ọ ga-abịa ma lụọ ya.

en: He would come back and tell the family that their daughter has died.
ibo: Ọ ga-abịaghachị gwazie ndị mụ nwa na nwunye ya anwụọla
mt0: Ọ ga-abịaghachi ma kọọ ndị nne na nna na nwa ha nwụrụ.

en: The man will proceed to do her burial ceremony
ibo: Nwoke ahụ ga-agazi n'ihu mee mmemme akwamozu ya.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ha n'ụzọ dị iche iche. Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ha n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: What will happen to who refused marrying a woman's corpse
ibo: Ihe ga-eme onye jụrụ ịlụ nwaanyị n'ozu:
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe.

en: Like Nze Ukaejuoha explained, these are what will befall who refused to marry a woman he did not pay her dowry at death
ibo: Dịka Nze Ụkaejuọha siri kọwaa, ihe ndị a bụ ihe ga-eme onye jụrụ ịlụ nwaanyị omeghị ihe isi ya n'ozu:
mt0: Nke a bụ ihe ndị a ga-eme onye ahụ nwere ike ịgbaghara nwaanyị ahụ n'ọnwụ ọ bụla ọ bụghị ịgbaghara ụgwọ ụgwọ ụmụaka ahụ n'ọnwụ ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla ọ bụla

en: That person would receive different punishments
ibo: Onye ahụ ga-enweta ntaramahụhụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwereghị ike ịkọwapụta ya.

en: He will also be met with different bad things.
ibo: Ihe ọjọọ dịkwa iche iche na-ezute onye ahụ
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwereghị ike ịkọwapụta ya.

en: Things will not go well with such a person.
ibo: Ihe anaghị agara onye dị otu a nke ọma
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịtụgharị n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịghọta ihe ndị a.

en: That person may also die a miserable death.
ibo: Onye ahụ nwekwara ike ịnwụ ọnwụ ihere
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: But such person may repent, most especially when all these things started befalling him.
ibo: Mana onye ahụ nwere ike ichegharị, tụmadụ ma ọ bụrụ na ihe ndakwasị niile a bido ịdakwasị ya.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ, ọ dị mma ịsị na ị maghị, ọ bụghị n'ihi na ihe ndị ahụ malite ịbịakwute ya.

en: What that person will do when he repents
ibo: Ihe onye ahụ ga-eme ma o chegharịa

en: Buhari later became president through election in democratic era in 2015, after three failed attempts at the position.
ibo: Buhari mechara bụrụ onyeisiala site na ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchi onye kwuo uche ya na'afọ 2015, ka ọgbara mbọ ịnweta ya bụ oche ugboro atọ n'efu.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwaghị okwu ahụ, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwereghị ike ịkọwa ya. Buhari n'ikpeazụ bịara onye isi ala n'oge demokrasi na 2015 mgbe atọ ndị ọzọ ndị ahụ enweghị ike ịbịakwute ọkwa ahụ.

en: Four years is elapsing but many people do not agree that he has made any remarkable achievements.
ibo: Afọ anọ na-abịa na ngwụcha mana ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ekweghị na ihe o mere pụtara ihe anya na-ahụ.
mt0: Ọ bụ naanị ị ga-atụle ndị mmadụ ndị ahụ n'oge ahụ, mana ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ ekweghị na ọ nwere ọrụ dị ịrịba ama.

en: He promised to defeat Boko Haram in the war Nigeria fights against the sect that wants an Islamic state in Northern Nigeria, but presently, this sect torments this intention of Buhari through its invasion of this area.
ibo: Okwere nkwa na ya ga emeri Boko Haram na-agha Naịjirịa na-ebuso ndị a chọro ikewapụta mba ofufe alakuba na ọwụwa anyanwụ ugwu Naịjirịa, mana na nso a, ndị a na-akpazị ike na-enye ebumnobi Buhari inọdụ n'oche onyisiala nsogbu site n'etu ha si awakpo mpaghara ahu.
mt0: Ọ kwuru na ọ ga-emeri Boko Haram n'agha ahụ n'etiti Nigeria na ndị ahụ na-achọ obodo Islam na ndịda Nigeria, mana ugbu a, ndị ahụ na-egbu n'ihi ndị ahụ na-achọ obodo Islam n'ime ndịda Nigeria.

en: Prominent individuals believe that Buhari will face strong contest with a more prominent non-ruling. The flag bearer of PDP, Atiku Abubakar is also an Islam from Northern Nigeria like Buhari.
ibo: Ndị ọnụ ha na-eru n'okwu kwenyere na Buhari ga-ezute ezigote ọgụ n'aka pati na-anọghị n'ọchịchi aha ha na-ada ụda karịa - onye bu ọkọlọtọ PDP bụ Atiku Abubakar bụkwa onye ofufe alakuba ma sikwa ugwu Naịjirịa dịka Buhari.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ, ndị ọkachamara nwere olileanya na Buhari ga-enweta nnukwu ọgụgụ isi n'etiti onye ọchịchị ọzọ dị n'etiti ndị ọchịchị ndị ọzọ. Onye ndị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ bụ Atiku Abubakar, onye bụ onye Islam nke Northern Nigeria dịka Buhari.

en: Olusegun Obasanjo: Why Atiku is better than Buhari
ibo: Olusegun Obasanjo: Ihe Atiku ji kara Buhari mma

en: Obasanjo told BBC that he has looked at what Buhari has done and realised that Atiku is better than him in manifolds.
ibo: Obasanjo gwara BBC na ya elelechar ihe Buhari mereela ma hụ na Atiku ka ya mma mmaji abụọ.

en: In his interactions he had with BBC Yoruba, the former president of Nigeria , Olusegun Obasanjo said that the former vice president and 2019 presidential aspirant, Atiku Abubakar.
ibo: Na mkparịtaụka ya na BBC Yoruba nwere, onye bụbu Onyeisiala Naịjirịa bụ Olusegun Obasanjo kwuru maka onye bụbu osote nakwa onye na-azo ọchịchị na ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị nke 2019 bụ Atiku Abubakar.
mt0: Ọ bụ na n'okwu ya na BBC Yoruba, onye bụbu president nke Nigeria Olusegun Obasanjo kwuru na onye bụbu vice president na onye ndị ndị ndị ndị n'oge 2019 bụ Atiku Abubakar.

en: He said that if he is told to choose now that he would choose Atiku over Buhari because of what has done.
ibo: O sị na asị ya hara ugbua na ya ga ahara Atiku karia Buhari n'ihi ihe Buhari merela.
mt0: Ọ sị na ọ bụrụ na a gwara ya ịhọrọ ugbu a, ọ ga-ahọrọ Atiku karịa Buhari n'ihi ihe ọ mere.

en: Those to choose from are between the one of APC and the one of PDP.

en: From what I saw with Buhari- gross incompetence, segregation, corruption, weakness of the body, mental weakness and others- compare him to Atiku.
ibo: Site n'ihe m huru n'aka Buhari- amaghị ọrụ ma ncha, ịkpa oke, nrụrụaka, adịghị ike ahụ, adịghị ike nke uche na ihe niile ndị ọzọ were ya tụnyere Atiku.
mt0: N'ihi ihe m hụla na Buhari- nnukwu n'enweghị ike, mmekọrịta, mmehie, ndị ahụ ndị ọzọ, ndị ahụ ndị ọzọ, ndị ọzọ - tụnyere ya na Atiku.

en: Atiku will do double folds better than Buhari.

en: Obasanjo explained that he believes th a President Muhammadu Buhari is worse than Atiku, which is why he did not support the youths within the 73 candidates vying for presidency.
ibo: Obasanjo kọwara na ya kwenyere na Onyeisiala Muhammadu Buhari ka Atiku njo, bu ihe mere ya jiri rapụ ikwado ndi ntoroọbịa n'ime mmadụ 73 na-azọ oche onyeisiala Naịjirịa.
mt0: Ọ sị na ọ nwere olileanya na onye isi ala Muhammadu Buhari dị njọ karịa Atiku, nke a bụ ihe kpatara o ji ekweghị nkwa ịkwado ndị nwanyị n'ime ndị ọzọ 73 ndị na-achọ ịbụ onye isi ala.

en: He also said what happened before the military invaded a village called Odi in 1999, which was when up to 2500 villagers died in the hands of the military.

mt0: Ọ kwuru ihe mere tupu ndị agha ndị agha nwere ike ịbanye n'obodo ahụ a kpọrọ Odi na 1999, ebe ndị agha nwere ike ịghọ ndị agha ndị agha ruo 2,500.

en: The new legislators of Imo State elected Mr Chiji Collins as their Speaker.
ibo: Ndịomeiwu ọhụrụ na steeti Imo ahoputala Maazi Chiji Collins dịka olu na-ekwuru ha.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ọhụrụ ndị ndị obodo Imo, ọ bụghị ị na-akpọ onye ọrụ gị bụ Chiji Collins dịka onye isi ha.

en: He is a member representing Isiala Mbano constituency of the state.
ibo: Nwa amadi a, bụ onye na-anọchite anya okpuruọchịchị Isiala Mbano nke steeti ahụ.
mt0: Ọ bụ onye ndị a na-akpọ onye ndị ahụ n'isiala Mbano constituency nke steeti ahụ.

en: He was elected without opposition.
ibo: A họpụtara ya na-enweghị onye mara ya aka n'ihu.
mt0: Ọ bụ naanị ị ga-akpọghachite ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche. Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkpọghachite ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkpọghachite ha n'enweghị ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

en: This is his second time of going to House of Assembly after he was first elected in 2015
ibo: Nke a bụ nke ugboro abụọ ọ na-aga n'ụlọomeiwu ahụ dịka ahọpụtachara ya nke mbụ n'afọ 2015.
mt0: Ọ bụ nke abụọ ọ na-aga n'Ụlọ Ọrụ Ndị Ọrụ n'oge ahụ n'ihi na ọ bụ onye a bụ onye a bụbu onye a n'ụlọ ọrụ ndị ọrụ n'afọ 2015.

en: The House of Assembly also elected Okechukwu Onyekanma, who is representing Mbaitoli constituency as his Deputy.
ibo: Uloomeiwu a họpụtakwara Okechukwu Onyekanma, bụ onye na-anọchite anya Mbaitoli nke steeti ahụ dịka osote ya.
mt0: Ọ bụkwa ndị nnọchiteanya ndị ahụ nwere ike ịhọrọ Okechukwu Onyekanma, onye na-arụ ọrụ n'ọgbakọ Mbaitoli dịka onye ndị nnọchiteanya ya.

en: A cattle herder has cut-off a girl's head in Ekiti.
ibo: Onye ọchịehi ebepụla isi nwaagbọghọ n'Ekiti
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ya. A cattle herder egbuola nwa nwaanyị n'Ekiti.

en: Ilasa Ekiti village of Ekiti state is now in conflict over the death of a girl whom a cattle herder cut off her head for refusing to marry him.
ibo: Obodo Ilasa Ekiti dị n'Ekiti Steeti nọ n'ọgbaghara ugbua n'ihi ọnwụ otu nwaagbọghọ onye ọchịehi bepuru isi maka na ọ jụrụ ịlụ ya.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ya. Ilasa Ekiti obodo dị na steeti Ekiti nọ ugbu a na ndị agha n'ihi ọnwụ nwa nwaanyị ahụ n'ihi na ọ jụrụ ịgbaghara nwoke ahụ.

en: This cattle herder whose name is not yet mentioned ambushed the girl on her way to fetch water and cut off her head on Tuesday.
ibo: Onye ọchịehi a a na-akpọbeghi aha ya chechiri nwaaghọghọ ahụ n'ụzọ ebe ọ gara ịkụte mmiri ma bepu ya isi na Tuzde.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta okwu ahụ, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ya, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ya.

en: A man has burnt a woman and her family for refusing to befriend him.

mt0: Ọ bụ onye ahụ egbuola nwaanyị na ezinụlọ ya n'ihi na ọ jụrụ ịbịakwute ya.

en: A man has killed his wife out of jealousy.

en: There was never a time we used computer to send election results.

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche. Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, sị na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta ndị ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche.

mt0: Ọ bụ n'ihi na ọ bụghị onye ọ bụla nwere ike ịkọwa aha ha maka ntuliaka 2019 nwere ike ịkọwa aha ha na komputa, na ndị ọzọ nwere ike ịkọwa aha ha.

en: The use of incident form will not stop manipulations going on in election.

mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, ọ dịghị eme ka ndị ahụ ghara ịmalite ịgbanwe n'oge ntuliaka.

en: He strongly affirmed 'It is only when computer is used for voting that one would say that something is in the server.
ibo: O kwusiri ike na 'ọ bụ naanị mgbe eji igwe kọmuta tụọ vootu ka a ga-asi na ihe dị na sava'.
mt0: Ọ kwuru n'ụzọ dị ike sị, 'Ọ bụ naanị mgbe igwe komputa a na-eji eme ntuliaka na onye ọ bụla nwere ike ịsị na ihe dị na server.

en: He said that he does not know about the result of 2019 elections being in the server.

en: On the same hand, BBC asked a renowned computer operator, Emeka Unachukwu what is server?
ibo: N'otu aka ahụ BBC jụkwara onye ọrụ kọmpụta ama ama bụ Emeka Unachukwu gịnị bụ 'server'?
mt0: On the other hand, BBC asked a renowned computer operator, Emeka Unachukwu, ihe bụ server?

en: Unachukwu said 'Server is a computer that links other computers used for storing different information together.
ibo: Unachukwu sị na 'Server' bụ kọmpụta na-ejikọ kọmpụta ndị ọzọ ọnụ eji edewe mkpụrụozi dị iche iche'.
mt0: Ọ bụ kọmputa a na-ejikọ igwe ndị ọzọ iji kọwaa ozi dị iche iche.

en: He said that INEC can say that they don't have server because there is another office storing data for them but it is not true that they don't have server since they have data.
ibo: O kwuru na Inec nwere ike ikwu na ha enweghị 'server' maka na o nwere ụlọọrụ ọzọ na e jidere ha mkpụrụozi mana ọ bụghị eziokwu na ha enweghị server' ebe e nwere mkpụrụozi.
mt0: Ọ sị na INEC nwere ike ịsị na ha enweghị server n'ihi na ọ dị n'ọzọ ụlọ ọrụ na-echekwa data maka ha mana ọ bụghị eziokwu na ha enweghị server n'ihi na ha nwere data.

en: He said that the internet has its own server where many people keep their information.
ibo: Ọ sị na Intanet nwere 'server' nke ya ebe ọtụtụ mmadụ na-edowe ozi ha.
mt0: Ọ sị na n'ihi na ị nwere ike ịkọwapụta n'ụzọ dị iche iche, ọ na-ekwu na n'ihi na ọtụtụ ndị nwere ike ịtọ ụtọ ozi ha na n'ịntanetị.

en: Unachukwu said 'INEC cannot say that don't have because they have where they store data.
ibo: Unachukwu sị na 'Inec agaghị asị na ha enweghị sava maka na ha nwere ebe ha na edowe mkpụrụozi bụ data.
mt0: Ọ bụ naanị ị ga-akpọ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ ndị ahụ

en: They may call this data base but it is server because that computer unites others together which can receive from or send message to it.'
ibo: Ha nwere ike kpọ nke a 'data base' mana ihe ọ bụ bụ sava maka na kọmpụta ahụ jikoro ndị ọzọ ọnụ bụ ndị nke nwere ike ịdọro ọzi maọbụ zite ọzi na ya'.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ha akpọghị ụlọ ọrụ a data n'ihi na ọ bụ server n'ihi na kọmputa ahụ na-ejikọta ndị ọzọ ọnụ n'ihi na ọ nwere ike ịnata ma ọ bụ ịziga ozi n'ebe ahụ.

en: He said it is difficult for INRC to say they don't have server.
ibo: Ọ sị na ọhịara ahụ Inec isi na ha enweghị server'.
mt0: Ọ sị na ọ dị mfe maka INRC ịsị na ha enweghị server.

en: If they are calling people to come and collect their PVCs they should be ready for elections.
ibo: Ha na-akpọ ndị mmadụ bịa were PVC ha dịrị njikere maka ntuliaka
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ha na-akpọ ndị mmadụ ịbịa n'ụlọ ọrụ ndị ahụ ịkwụnye ụmụ ndị ahụ PVC ha, ha kwesịrị ịdị njikere maka ntuliaka.

en: Unachukwu said that even if voting was done and transmitted manually to where it was counted, INEC will still put it in the server.
ibo: Unachukwu kwuru na ọ bụrụgodi na a tụrụ vootu n'aka buru ya n'aka buga ebe a gụrụ ya, na Inec ga-etinyekwa ya na ya bụ 'server'.
mt0: Ọ bụ ezie na ndị ahụ kwuru na ọ bụrụ na ndị ahụ nwere ike ịtụ ụtụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche ma ọ bụrụ na a na-atụ ụtụ n'ụzọ dị iche iche, INEC ga-etinye ya na server.

en: But they can say they have not keyed the result of 2019 election in the server which shows that they have not finished their work.
ibo: Mana ha nwere ike ikwu na ha etinyebeghị mpụtara 2019 na ya bụ 'server' nke gosiri na ha arụchabeghị ọrụ ha.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe, sị na ị nwere ike ịsị na ha enweghị ike ịkọwapụta nkọwapụta nke ntuliaka 2019 na server nke pụtara na ha enweghị ike ịrụ ọrụ ha.

en: He said that yesterday, when he visited the Dapchi community in yobe state, the place where those students were abducted last month.

ibo: O kwuru na oge atọrọ ụmụaka Chibok, Jonathan kpọrọ oku nzukọ ndị nchekwa, ebe Buhari kagburu nzukọ ndị nchekwa n'oge atọrọ ụmụaka Dapchi.
mt0: Ọ sị na Jonathan na-akpọ maka nchekwa dị mma n'oge ndị a na-akpọchi ụmụaka Chibok ma Buhari jụrụ n'okwu a maka nchekwa n'oge ndị a na-akpọchi ụmụaka Dapchi.

en: He explained that when the son Yusuf Buhari had an accident, Buhari cancelled all his appointments and visited him at the hospital
ibo: O kwukwara n'oge Yusuf Buhari nwere ihe mberede okproụzọ na Buhari kagburu njem niile onwere, ma gawa ileta nwa ya n'ụlọọgwụ.
mt0: Ọ kọwara na mgbe nwa ya Yusuf Buhari nwere ngozi, Buhari emechara ọtụtụ n'ime ndị ọrụ ya niile ma hụ ya na ụlọ ọgwụ.

en: 'National Demographic and health survey' research which took place in the year 2013, shows that in Nigeria, women between the range of 15 years to 19 years who are married are 28.2% while from the age of 35 to 39are 89.4%
ibo: Dịka nchọpụta nke ọnụọgụgụ na ahụike nke a kpọrọ 'National Demographic and Health Survey' na bekee e mere n'afọ 2013 siri gosipụta, n'ala Naijiria, ụmụnwaanyị dị bido afọ 15 rue afọ 19 lụrụ di dị pasentị 28.2, ebe ndị dị afọ 35 rue afọ 39 lụrụ di dị pasentị 89.4.
mt0: N'afọ 2013, nnyocha 'National Demographic and Health Survey' gosipụtara na n'obodo Nigeria, ndị nwanyị n'etiti afọ 15 ruo 19 ndị ahụ nwere mmekọahụ bụ 28.2% n'ebe ndị nwanyị n'etiti afọ 35 ruo 39 ndị ahụ bụ 89.4%.

en: According to Mojisola Adeyeye's note, this banning was in line with their investigation from those pharmaceutical companies.
ibo: N'akwụkwọ ozi onyeisi Nafdac bụ Mojisola Adeyeye wepụtara, mmechi a sotara nchọpụta ha mere dịka ha gachara n'ụlọọrụ ndị ahụ.
mt0: Ọ dị ka Mojisola Adeyeye kwuru, iwu ahụ bụ n'okpuru nnyocha ha na ụlọ ọrụ ọgwụ ndị a.

en: Because there was no evidence found on the 2nd of May against these companies, Peace Standard Pharmaceutical Limited, Bioraj Pharmaceutical Ltd and Emzor pharmaceuticals Ind Ltd, in their companies at Ilorin and Lagos, we decided to shut them down
ibo: N'ihi e nwetaghị ihe akaebe zuru oke na mbọ igbochi iwepụta akwụkwọ kwesịrị oge anyị mere nyocha anyị n'ụbọchị 2 nke ọnwa Mee, n'ụlọọrụ ha dị n'Ịlorin na Lagos, ọ dị mkpa ka e mechie ụlọọrụ mmepụta ahịa ụlọọrụ atọ ndị a - Peace Standard Pharmaceutical Limited ; Bioraj Pharmaceutical Limited na Emzor Pharmaceuticals Ind Ltd .
mt0: N'ihi na enweghị ihe ọmụma n'ụbọchị nke abụọ nke Mee n'ihe banyere ụlọ ọrụ ndị a, Peace Standard Pharmaceutical Limited, Bioraj Pharmaceutical Ltd na Emzor pharmaceuticals Ind Ltd, na ụlọ ọrụ ha na Ilorin na Lagos, anyị kpebiri ịkwụsị ha.

en: This is to enable effective and thorough investigations.
ibo: Nke a bụ iji nye ohere maka nchọpụta zuru oke.
mt0: Ọ bụrụ na ị nwere ike ịkọwa okwu ahụ n'ụzọ dị mfe ma dị nkọwa, sị na ị nwereghị ike ịkọwa ya.

en: Nafdac are working with the discoveries and findings of BBC news.
